alert.note: Alert for Cecil; Southeast Harford (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 15 at 8:55PM EST until January 18 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Two to three feet of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Cecil and Southeast Harford Counties. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through late Monday night, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, the marina office at the Havre de Grace Yacht Basin is flooded, along with the surrounding area. Hutchins Park is flooded, as is the parking lot at Roberts Park. The dock at Pier Number 1 is also covered by water. At 6.1 feet, flooding begins along Back Creek in Chesapeake City, Elk River near Courthouse Point, Hollywood Beach and Port Herman, and along Bohemia River near Town Point. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides up to 5 feet above normal. The next high tide at Havre de Grace is at 9:15 AM and 8:59 PM Sunday. The next high tide at Chesapeake City is at 9:19 PM tonight and 9:36 AM Sunday. The next high tide at Charlestown is at 9:29 PM tonight and 9:00 AM Sunday. The next high tide at Port Deposit is at 9:01 PM tonight and 8:32 AM Sunday. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
